reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Improve access to food for 1050 IDP families in Kaxda District Benadir region through cash based support

description.narrative: The proposed project seeks to improve access to food for the most vulnerable IDP H.H living Kaxda district in Benadir region - Somalia. The project targets 1050 households comprising of 6,130 boys, girls, women and Men. Project time frame will span in a period of 5 months. The primary target is the most vulnerable families in integrated food security classification (IPC) 4 amp 5 that currently displaced from Lower Shabelle and part of middle Shabelle living in Kaxda district. Monthly cash support of $52 per household in a period of 3 months will be transferred according to the recommendation of CMWG and as per the October, 2018 minimum expenditure basket (MEB) value published by FSNU. The cash support is expected to improve food consumption and reduce the use of negative coping mechanisms that exposes children and other vulnerable groups to the risk of starvation and malnutrition. Project will transfer cash to 1050 households living in 11 IDP camps in Kaxda. The project funding being sort, will be transferred through a period of three months. The overall project time-frame is 5 moths first month will be mobilization, preparation and beneficiary identification, the next 3 months cash transfer will continue and the last month will be for project closure, finalization, performance evaluation and undertaking final post transfer monitoring (PTM). The transfer modality will be through EVC PLUS (electronic money transfer modality) service offered by Hormuud company in which each beneficiary will receive money directed to his/her telephone number. Community-based selection approach will be used in selection and identification of beneficiaries in which members from the target IDP community comprising men and women play an active role as they form camp relief committees (CRC). CRC and overall community will be mobilized on vulnerability-based selection to identify 1050 households. Public verification will be made, and this will encourage transparency and fair selection. Project will setup feedback and compliant mechanism where people can be able to show their concerns. A hotline number will be shared with the beneficiaries to freely communicate with the team. Also, accountability officer will be hired in the project to ensure accountability frameworks are practiced in the project.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
